intro: Castilleja tayloriorum, commonly known as Taylor's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is a hemiparasitic species that attaches to the roots of other plants. The plant produces bright orange to yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
